pitfalls & warnings.pitfall_desc: The metadata file (codemeta or other) has a version which does not correspond to the version used in the latest release
LICENSE file contains template placeholders like <program>, <year>, <name of author> that were not replaced
Metadata files have multiple authors in single field instead of a list
In codemeta.json README property pointing to their homepage/wiki instead of README file
codemeta.json referencePublication refers to software archive instead of paper
The metadata file has License pointing to a local file instead of stating the name
CITATION.cff does not have referencePublication even though it's referenced in codemeta.json
The metadata file softwareRequirement points to an invalid page
The metadata file coderepository points to their homepage
LICENSE file only contains copyright information without actual license terms
codemeta.json IssueTracker violates the expected URL format
codemeta.json downloadURL is outdated
The metadata file License does not have the specific version
codemeta.json uses bare DOIs in the identifier field instead of full https://doi.org/ URL
In codemeta.json contIntegration link returns 404
The metadata file codeRepository does not point to the same repository
codemeta.json version does not match the package's
codemeta.json Identifier uses raw SWHIDs without their resolvable URL
Inconsistent author counts found across metadata files

pitfalls & warnings.warning_desc: Software requirements in metadata files don't have version specifications
The dateModified in codemeta.json is outdated compared to the actual repository last update date
Codemeta.json repository has multiple licenses but only one is listed
Programming languages in codemeta.json do not have versions
The metadata file softwareRequirements have more than one req, but it's written as one string
codemeta.json Identifier is a name instead of a valid unique identifier, but an identifier exist
The metadata file GivenName is a list instead of a string

pitfalls & warnings.pitfall_desc: codemeta.json developmentStatus is a URL instead of a string
The metadata file codeRepository uses Git remote-style shorthand instead of full URL
